gov.va.med.lom.foundation.util

Class DescriptionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.lom.foundation.util.DescriptionBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class DescriptionBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Provides the capability to describe objects contents. This class can safely handle circular references, as it will only fully describe each instance once, and subsequently describe only its class and hashcode.

      • append

        public DescriptionBuilder append(java.lang.Object value)
        Describes a given object. The method recognizes the following types:
        • Strings are put between single quotes
        • Numbers use toString()
        • Booleans use toString()
        • Characters use toString()
        • Dates are formatted according to the set DescriptionBuilder.Properties.getDateFormat() format
        • Classes are shown as set by DescriptionBuilder.Properties.useFullClassName()
      • arrays (both primitive and Object)
      • Lists
      • Maps are sorted by key
      • Sets are sorted by value
      • Describeable uses the describe() method
      • JavaBeans uses BeanInfo to find the properties
      For any other types the method simply uses java.lang#toString().
Parameters:
value - The object to describe.
Returns:
The description

  • header

    public DescriptionBuilder header(java.lang.Object object)
    Describe the generic object properties, such as the unqualified class name and the hash code. The output will look as follows: @
    Parameters:
    object - The object to create the description header for.
